text: Congratulations to Columbus native, Yuri Kubo! Out of more than 8,000 applicants, he was just selected to join NASA’s All-American 2025 Class of Astronauts. 🚀 We’re over-the-moon proud to have Yuri representing #CD6 and carrying Hoosier excellence into America’s space program! #NASA

Last week in @HouseForeignGOP, we advanced efforts to modernize the State Department — delivering America First priorities with fiscal responsibility in foreign policy. 🇺🇸 #AmericaFirst https://t.co/AB8oHsygFP

Indiana is the RV Capital of the World!

I appreciated meeting with Nathan Hart and his team at Walnut Ridge Family RV in Henry County. As a @TransportGOP member, I value every chance to discuss transportation here in the Hoosier state! #RVCapital  #Transportation https://t.co/JigdnKA433

I toured the Whitewater Valley Station of @ImpaPower — a vital source of energy for Wayne County.

I got a firsthand look at the station that keeps Richmond running — through the summer heat and the winter chill! ❄️☀️ #Energy #HoosierPower https://t.co/uu93eVkn08

Thanks to @ZachNunn for highlighting my Stop Scams Caucus in a @FinancialCmte hearing. Foreign scammers target millions of Americans daily — we’re taking action in Congress to fight back. https://t.co/VeHf2g4TeI

In @TransportGOP this week, we passed legislation to reauthorize federal pipeline safety programs — strengthening America’s energy infrastructure with safer, smarter, and more innovative solutions. #EnergySecurity #PipelineSafety https://t.co/AHUGBZzihL

Scam centers in Southeast Asia — built on corruption & human trafficking — stole $16.6B from Americans last year. My amendment creates a task force to shut them down. This is a national security & human rights problem that l aim to fix. https://t.co/ihdzrv2QG0
🌾 Big news for Hoosier farmers! Taiwan — the 8th largest market for U.S. ag products — just announced major purchases of Indiana corn and soybeans. #HoosierFarmers #USTaiwan https://t.co/uJwum1lzW8
https://t.co/tkqV9osNO0

✈️ Proud moment for Indiana! For the fourth year in a row, Indianapolis International Airport ranks #1 among medium airports in North America.

IND is routinely recognized as one of the very best airports in the country — a gateway that reflects our Hoosier spirit of hospitality and excellence. #Indiana #INTravel #BestAirport
Honored to preside over the House Floor this week with the gavel in hand—proud to represent #CD6! https://t.co/g63STzp3MJ

I met with Secretary Sean Duffy for an aerial tour of the I-69 completion in Indiana. As a member of @TransportGOP, I’ll continue pushing for federal support to finish this vital highway.

Secretary Duffy is leading the Administration’s effort to make sure America is building again — and this project proves once more that Indiana is truly the Crossroads of America.

Proud to announce my first bill has passed Congress! The bipartisan CASE Act cuts wasteful courthouse spending & protects taxpayer dollars. A win for fiscal responsibility + Hoosier common sense. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/bbF1Xe8VeL
https://t.co/zXsd8dZ70A

I participated in 45 gatherings with Hoosiers last month during my 'Hoosier Heartland Tour.' There was a consistent message: Hoosiers want to live in a nation that is safe, affordable, and responsive to their needs. I welcomed these opportunities to report back on my work in DC. I valued every opportunity to hear from Hoosiers across #CD6.

I appreciated the opportunity to share, listen and learn from some of the most engaged members of Richmond’s business community. My thanks to the Wayne County Chamber of Commerce for hosting the forum with Wayne County constituents. https://t.co/k0TxngIIv0

I'm grateful to have had my two measures included in the passage of our defense bill. These two amendments serve to counter Iran's threats of terrorist operations in our hemisphere. And they will enhance our military readiness across our defense infrastructure.

I'm committed to bolstering our nation's defenses, and to enhancing our military readiness.
Speaker Johnson gaveled in the House on this solemn 9/11 morning. I was humbled to be asked to lead the Pledge of Allegiance on this day. https://t.co/QIiwITSMVY

Two dozen years ago — on a beautiful fall morning much like this one — I sat in my office in disbelief as the horrors of 9/11 unfolded. I will never forget. May WE never forget. https://t.co/bgO87IRQ3g

Heartbreaking news of the assassination of Charlie Kirk. He was a young leader of America’s conservative movement. More importantly, he was a husband, father, son — an inspiration to many. I offer my prayers for his family. And I pray for peace.

When Hoosiers get hit with big storms or flooding -- emergency resources must be at the ready. FEMA does amazing work in assisting our communities after a disaster.

In @TransportGOP, we advanced crucial FEMA reforms to ensure that local relief efforts are fast and fair. This legislation both streamlines states' disaster response while protecting taxpayers.
https://t.co/XNS53ucHmd

I voted to hold China accountable for fentanyl trafficking. Congress took decisive action this week to stop the outflow of deadly Chinese fentanyl into our communities. 

The Chinese need to lock it down — or face costly U.S. sanctions.

I appreciated the opportunity to tour @Ascensionorg’s Indy South Emergency Department. I got a firsthand view of St. Vincent’s emergency and immediate care delivery in #CD6. Quality care — close to home. https://t.co/5E4EcVpUhc
Our nation was built with the hard work and dedication of the American workforce. Hoosiers exemplify that strong work ethic everyday. Happy Labor Day all! https://t.co/fJnQzljkXz

Fourteen Indiana hospital CEOs met with me in New Castle this week. I'm working to help safeguard our rural hospitals in #CD6. The work is not easy. I appreciated the plain talk. I’m listening and learning. I’ll bring these conversations back with me to DC. https://t.co/75tFJgrUM3
https://t.co/tqbjQ0ORhc

As Hoosiers hit the highways this Labor Day weekend, you can look forward to the lowest gas prices in 5 years! We’re unleashing American energy dominance — bringing lower prices at the pumps for Hoosier families.

.@INFarmBureau pulled Fayette county growers together in Glenwood. We discussed the tax relief offered to farm families in the One Big Beautiful Bill. We talked trade, tariff and labor policies…all of which matter mightily to our Hoosiers farmers. https://t.co/L2Ljzu23IY

In my work on the @TransportGOP Highways subcommittee, we’re focused on rebuilding America’s infrastructure. We need A LOT of concrete  to make that happen. Heidelberg Cement built a $650M plant here in Indiana.  I was eager to get a close-up look this week! https://t.co/ZnxqCSTmt4

Propane power. It’s big — especially in rural parts of Indiana. I met some of the good people at @KeystoneCoop in Shelby County. Propane heats 20,000 homes in #CD6 — and powers everything from school buses to forklifts. https://t.co/MF7V4WRBXU

The team @AspireJohnsonCo leads advocates for our Johnson County business community. They gathered a full house for their August meeting — and put me up front to engage with local leaders, constituents, and small business owners.

I’m grateful for these opportunities to share updates on my work — and to listen!

Beer is big business. And we’ve got a homegrown success story here in #CD6. 
@ZinkDistribCo serves Anheuser-Busch customers across central Indiana. Three generations of the Zink family continues to grow and employ hardworking Hoosiers. It was a pleasure to meet their team. https://t.co/9z14KNya9M

I appreciated another opportunity to talk with constituents in Hancock County during my Hoosier Heartland Tour. The One Big Beautiful Bill was the main topic of conversation. We discussed the tax relief this legislation delivers for ALL working citizens. It’ll keep more money in the pockets of hardworking Hoosiers across #CD6 — and incentivize business investment to expand America’s economy.
https://t.co/nQoEudwxjD

Greenwood was just ranked the #4 best city in Indiana — and by US News and World Reports! I have the privilege of representing this Johnson County gem. It’s also the home to our district office. Kudos to community leaders, including Mayor Mark Myers, for leading Greenwood’s climb. Come visit!  #CD6

The @NationalGuardIN hosted Technology Readiness Experimentation this week. It was our opportunity to showcase 80 new defense technologies — both static displays in Franklin and live fire demos at Camp Atterbury. #CD6 was in the defense innovation spotlight! https://t.co/kC6mcF0vvo

Global engagement matters mightily to Indiana's economic growth. I serve on @HouseForeignGOP where I’m working to strengthen American leadership in our global economy. Indiana’s chapter of the @USGLC is an ally. I’m thankful for the opportunity to advance ideas with their board. https://t.co/YrYwuhkbWr
Today, we honor and remember the bravery of our wounded and fallen heroes. They put their lives on the line to protect our nation. We are eternally grateful. https://t.co/PYBmQRc2y7

I visited Richmond’s airport with Mayor Ron Oler, city council members and aviation board commissioners. State Rep Dr. Brad Barrett also joined us to discuss priorities to make their airfield a better gateway to eastern Indiana. Airports matter. They make it easier to attract industry to invest in communities like Richmond. #CD6

The One Big Beautiful Bill delivers tax relief for hardworking Hoosiers — whether they work on an assembly line or in a boardroom. I appreciated the opportunity to share details on the benefits with constituents in Greenfield last week.

Provisions of my Build The Wall Act were included in the Big Bill. These funds will complete our southern border wall.

I'm working to deliver legislation that’ll keep more money in the pockets of Hoosiers. And secure our communities. We’re making progress. The work continues!

https://t.co/1n8v0vfLmW
Picture perfect weather for this weekend’s start of the State Fair. We gathered bright and early for the Indiana Pork Ham Breakfast to kick it all off! https://t.co/XnA7UdwYV7
Lunch, listening and learning today from #CD6 ag leaders. It was good sharing the table with farming friends. https://t.co/rY4laJuJ6P
Wayne County Sheriff Randy Retter and his team brought me current on their public safety work. They run a tight ship, and a model county jail! https://t.co/k5QtBNkveu

An aviation tragedy that hit close to home…The Greenwood community is deeply saddened by yesterday’s plane crash. Our prayers are with the family of the pilot who lost her life. And yet we're grateful that more lives weren’t lost on the ground near this busy intersection.

Aviation safety is central to my work on the @TransportGOP Aviation subcommittee. I’ll follow this NTSB investigation closely.

https://t.co/Kl8PaYAV4y

Lunch with Leaders in Wayne County. Big ideas were on the menu. I joined Richmond Councilman and Warm Glow owner Justin Burkhart, State Rep. Brad Barrett, Wayne County Commissioner Brad Dwenger and Councilwoman Misty Hollis at Centerville’s Warm Glow Candle Company. They're working together to grow a better Wayne community.

At the Indiana Ag Policy Summit today. We heard from @ISDADirector Don Lamb and @GovBraun. Details on the USDA hub coming to Indy: Good news for Hoosier farmers and all taxpayers. New ag technology showcased, too. https://t.co/puGAgiGD4W

Greenwood’s airport is home to an innovative program to train high school students for aviation careers. I joined my friends Mayor Mark Myers and Secretary Mike Speedy to learn more. Helpful visit, as I work on the @TransportGOP’s Aviation subcommittee in Congress. https://t.co/TmsJ4SOhS3

Our Washington office was presented with the U.S. Army seal by Major David Prewitt. He’s an officer from the 82nd Airborne Division down in Fort Bragg, NC. We'll proudly display the Army’s seal in our Capitol Hill office, as a tribute to the oldest and largest branch of our Armed Forces.

I’m eager to launch my Hoosier Heartland Tour for the summer! For 7 months, I’ve been working to deliver for our communities. I'm eager to share my work and bring these wins back home. I look forward to many meaningful visits and conversations with constituents as I travel across #CD6!

Export Control Officers help prevent adversaries including China from accessing sensitive U.S. technology. I co-led legislation that strengthens our export control enforcement. Congress must safeguard America's competitive technological edge over our adversaries.
https://t.co/0MrAdVyqyc

#CD6 sits at the crossroads of America. And we’re growing a vibrant distribution-based economy.  I met with members of the @TCANews and Landstar Trucking. Landstar has a big field operations center in Marion County. Opportunities to meet with leaders of our transportation industry help advance my work on @TransportGOP for #CD6.

As a member on @HouseForeignGOP, I’ve learned of the growing threat the Iranian regime poses in our own hemisphere. I introduced the BANNED in Latin America Act with @RepJoshG to address the rising threat of terrorist operations and Iranian influence in our Western Hemisphere. https://t.co/ak2S9lq8X2

.@INFarmBureau’s president Randy Kron was on Capitol Hill. It’s always helpful to compare notes on our #CD6 farm economy. Hoosier farmers are well represented under Randy’s leadership. We’re working together — to take care of our growers back home! https://t.co/nSMWR6mPOQ

I serve on the @RepublicanStudy National Security Task Force. Our mission is to prioritize policies focused on our nation’s defense. This week, we met with CIA Director John Ratcliffe on some of the front and center issues facing America’s intelligence community. Our intel needs to stay ahead of our global adversaries. This work never ends!

IU students from the @hamiltonlugar School were on Capitol Hill. We discussed my work on the @HouseForeignGOP . As an IU alum, I appreciated the opportunity to connect with these bright students. @IndianaUniv is educating the next generation of global leaders! https://t.co/gcvIClE60Z

Our Hoosier Soybean growers were on Capitol Hill this week. Phil Ramsey is from Shelby County in #CD6, and serves farmers across the district on the Shelby County Farm Bureau Board.

I’m working to advance policies that support Indiana’s farm economy. https://t.co/ADMwK0LPSo

We were joined this week by Secretary of Transportation @SecDuffy in @TransportGOP. I asked about the Department’s efforts to strengthen our transportation workforce. I supported legislation that now enables the use of  529 Education Savings Plan dollars to help students pursue careers in aviation — as pilots, mechanics, or in other crucial roles.

I was encouraged to hear directly from Secretary Duffy that DOT will utilize this legislative tool to drive workforce development. It’ll help safeguard the future for our aviation industry.

I joined St. Rep. Michelle Davis at one of the new markers that commemorate the State Trooper Aaron Smith Memorial Highway section of US 31 in Johnson Co. 

Rep. Davis spearheaded this extraordinary recognition of her late constituent, Aaron Smith. Aaron was a young Trooper who died while protecting our community. I thank our Johnson County Sheriff’s office, Indiana Fraternal Order of Police, and local leaders for their combined efforts to honor  a trooper who gave his life for us.

Congratulations to Bryan Bedford on being confirmed as the next Administrator of the FAA. Until just recently, Bryan was the highly-respected CEO of Indiana-headquartered Republic Airways. Republic operates the regional jet service for big airlines across the USA. He knows America’s airports and our air traffic control system.

I serve on the @TransportGOP Committee. I look forward to working with Bryan to advance aviation in #IN06, as we invest in America's air traffic control system.
https://t.co/K4wxmphbAf

Mary and I are heartbroken for those who lost loved ones in the recent Texas flooding. Our prayers are with the devastated families and communities.

Indiana’s Task Force One deployed to Texas. They’re on the ground, helping with search and rescue efforts. We're grateful to our selfless Hoosier first responders who stand ready to serve in moments such as this one.
https://t.co/CPEBmBElYQ
https://t.co/ZnaKni8GFc

Scammers are increasingly targeting Hoosiers. Especially the elderly and unsuspecting. This Channel 13 news video shows how scammers can ruin lives. It can be devastating.

I'm working to prevent these crimes. They often originate from massive scam centers based in Southeast Asia. I introduced legislation to STOP scammers by giving our federal law enforcement the tools needed to prevent crippling scams like the one in this video:
https://t.co/XRNwZRGVXY

Our office is now accepting internship applications for the Fall. I value the opportunity to work with bright, young Hoosiers in our Washington and Greenwood offices. Please visit my website, or click the link below to apply for a paid internship with us! https://t.co/ruA8mbz4KM
Mary and I wish our neighbors across #CD6 a Happy Independence Day! https://t.co/B6qGDlmgSl

Proud to have provisions of my key legislation, the Build the Wall Act, included in H.R. 1 — the Budget Reconciliation bill. We're delivering meaningful results for Hoosier families, workers and employers alike. https://t.co/oBonQvooCn

Hoosiers continue to be targeted by foreign scammers. I wrote a letter to @SecRubio urging our State Department to utilize all available tools to crack down on foreign scam operations. 

I was joined by my colleagues on @HouseForeignGOP.  We must protect Americans from the costly impacts of foreign scams.

One of @amazon’s distribution centers is located in Greenwood — employing over 2,500 Hoosier associates. I walked the massive floor of their high-tech facility — and saw the nonstop action firsthand. Amazon’s nightly presence is yet another reminder that #CD6 sits at the Crossroads of America.

I was grateful to have my amendment pass in our 2026 Military Construction & Veterans Affairs funding bill this week.

The amendment serves to fund new aviation maintenance hangars and an operations building at the Shelbyville Army Aviation Support Facility that sits alongside I-74. This investment in #CD6 is crucial to supporting our @NationalGuardIN — and their ability to provide rapid homeland response.

The Director of the Army National Guard, Lt. General Jonathan Stubbs presented our office with the National Guard’s seal today.  We’ll display it with pride in our Capitol Hill office.

Gen. Stubbs (3 Stars) and I discussed the impressive work of our @NationalGuardIN — and their proud history of homeland protection in Indiana, and their participation in our nation’s defense around the globe.

The “peaceful protests” that occurred in Los Angeles this month were anything but that. Today, I voted to condemn those riots. They reminded me of the shameful rioting in downtown Indianapolis just a few years ago!  Burning cars and robbing stores is not a peaceful demonstration of our 1st amendment rights. We must ensure that law and order is maintained. Our law enforcement officers deserve our steady support.
Thankful to have @SBA_Kelly in Indy to spotlight Hoosier small businesses! In Congress, I’m working to deliver tax relief for our local employers — and strengthen American manufacturing!

The One Big Beautiful Bill delivers tax relief for hard-working Hoosiers:

✅ NO tax on tips
✅ NO tax on overtime
✅ NO tax on Social Security

.@forviagroup_..a company that a lot of folks may not have heard of…is manufacturing in 40 countries around the globe — and in Columbus, Indiana. I toured their Gladstone plant with Mayor Mary Ferdon and Rep. Ryan Lauer as we learned more about Forvia’s local contribution to the global automotive supply chain.
Sharing time with Sheriff Chris Lane…down in Bartholomew County. I’m always eager to be helpful to our 11 sheriffs in #CD6, as their teams work to keep their counties safe. https://t.co/9xkn8HV4jp

Iran was offered a diplomatic path. It chose defiance. Iran repeatedly sought the destruction of Israel. For 40 years, Iran has chanted “Death to America.” It was responsible for killing over 1,000 U.S. service members through their IEDs. There could not be world peace with a nuclear-armed Iran.

I agreed with and support the military action taken by the President. I’m grateful to our service members for their precise action against Iran. We accomplish peace through strength.

We celebrated another significant investment in Indiana. I attended the Stoops Freightliner ribbon cutting in Indy. This facility will add another 100 Hoosier jobs at Stoops, and help keep central Indiana at the forefront of the trucking industry! Indiana sits at the Crossroads of America. I’m working to advance these Hoosier priorities on @TransportGOP in Congress.

.@JCREMC supplies reliable electric service across 32,000 meters in four Indiana counties — including Johnson and Shelby counties. I toured their HQ and command center, and heard from the leadership team. Johnson County REMC is working hard to power our communities in #CD6. https://t.co/8UeuOu88A8

Our EMS personnel are vital to our communities and livelihoods. I participated in an EMS Roundtable — hearing from agency leaders across the state. We discussed issues impacting our first responders and how I can further support them in Congress. https://t.co/d7EHMQqdid

What a game! Our @Pacers left it all on the court for a decisive Game 6 win!
On to Game 7!  #YesCers

I joined Bound Tree Medical on a tour of their state of the art facility in Greenwood. They’re a leading distributor of emergency medical equipment — servicing our first responders. The work done here provides our emergency personnel with the tools they need to provide life-saving assistance. I’m proud to have such a facility in #CD6.

CD6 is home to 32,000 Hoosier veterans. I had the opportunity to welcome @SecVetAffairs, Doug Collins, to the Roudebush @IndyVAMC this month. We discussed care and access for our veterans. I'm working to ensure that our vets receive the benefits they earned through their service to our country.

Today marks the 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army. Since 1775, the @USArmy has kept our nation safe and secure. Join me in honoring our soldiers, past and present — who have served our nation. https://t.co/Xku7Dn2Jfe

I welcomed our #CD6 art competition winner, Kobey Knight, to our nation’s capital! I enjoyed sharing the experience with Kobey. It’s an opportunity to  highlight our district and his artistic talent. It was a pleasure showing Kobey and his dad around this week. 

The students’ artwork is showcased in the corridor that connects my office to our Capitol. It’s the busiest corridor in Congress! The perfect place to showcase his artistic talent.

Continued support for Alzheimer’s research is crucial. We can’t put this sort of research on “pause.” It’d be costly, in terms of the clinical trials underway. And in terms of lives! We are on the cusp of breakthroughs. I heard from members of @AdvocacyAlzin who were on Capitol Hill this week to advocate for continued investments in Alzheimer's research.

There are empty courtrooms across the country — all funded by millions of taxpayer dollars. My bill eliminates unnecessary costs in courthouse construction and operation that drain the pockets of taxpayers. This is yet another way to address our federal deficit and rein in our wasteful spending. 

I was pleased to advance this bill out of @TransportGOP and to the House Floor!
https://t.co/anVabpMnAB
Thank you to @RepBrianFitz for supporting my STOP Scammers Act. It's time we take action and combat foreign scam centers. It's too often that Americans are targets of predatory scams!

.@HouseGOP is sending the HALT Fentanyl Act to the President’s desk — giving law enforcement the tools needed to keep fentanyl off of our streets. Too many Indiana communities have suffered the impact of deadly fentanyl. This bill is crucial and commonsense legislation. I’m proud to have helped move it one step closer to becoming law.

.@RickFOP86 President of Indy’s Fraternal Order of Police was on Capitol Hill and at the White House. He got me current on policing priorities back home, to keep our Indy officers both safe and supported. I appreciate Rick’s leadership —  on both the local and the national stage. https://t.co/Mpc3w0RUmK

Indianapolis International Airport has long been recognized as one of America’s best mid-sized airports. @INDairport just welcomed nonstop service to Dublin, Ireland. This @AerLingus route reflects the growing global reach of our Hoosier economy. I look forward to continuing my work on @TransportGOP to support IND and the dozen other public airports across #CD6!

I was honored to receive the @USMC seal at our DC office from Lt. Colonel Matthew Lamb — a Hoosier from Connersville and a fellow IU alum!  We’ll proudly display the Marine Seal in our Capitol Hill office as a tribute to the Marines who serve our country! #CD6 https://t.co/lyHZwvYRjO

Congratulations to Kobey Knight of Greenwood for winning our 2025 Congressional Art Competition! His piece, America's Comeback, was crafted to represent the strength and integrity of the American people. I'm eager to have Kobey’s artwork displayed in the U.S. Capitol. It’ll proudly represent Indiana's 6th Congressional District!

So many Hoosiers get scam messages — including myself! My bill works to combat these scams and protect those receiving toll road texts, calls, emails, and more! I dive deeper into this legislation with @1010wcsi's John Foster. https://t.co/DjdoH6eGWj

The @IndianaREALTORS were out in force on Capitol Hill this week. Realtors from #CD6 huddled in my office to share their housing priorities as they work to increase home ownership in Indiana — a goal I share with them! https://t.co/PIQCrORRK0
.@TransportGOP conducted an Aviation subcommittee hearing this week. We’re hard at work prioritizing aviation safety, and modernizing America’s air traffic control system. https://t.co/diGVlPKXzH

We pause this morning to remember and honor our brave troops who stormed the beaches of Normandy on D-Day.

156,000 Allied troops — including 73,000 sons of America — braved the bloody beachhead to protect our freedoms; to defend democracy.

We particularly honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice. June 6th was the turning point in WWII. Their sacrifices shaped the course of our history.  Let us not forget!

Novartis, a Swiss drug company, began investing here big-time just a few years ago. They’re producing life-saving cancer drugs, including Pluvito. Cancer drugs of this type are game changers. The investment in their development is huge. I toured their facility with my team. We couldn’t take pics of the coolest stuff we saw.  But believe me… it’s game changing. My office will do all we can to foster this sort of economic development in #CD6.

We welcomed the new president of @IndianaLandmark, Brad Ward —  pictured right. Brad is charged with carrying forward the proud tradition of protecting our architectural heritage in Indiana. Good luck, Brad! https://t.co/Uy5LQzoxG4

The @IndianaChamber invited me to address their big board of directors at their spring retreat. I talked Federal issues, while Statehouse Minority leader Phil GiaQuinta discussed State issues. It was a wide-ranging, balanced convo with a room full of engaged business leaders from across our state!

I joined @GovBraun and House colleagues in welcoming Doug Collins, Secretary of our Veterans Administration, to Indy. @SecVetAffairs runs a department with 460,000 Federal employees and 170 VA hospitals — one of which serves a lot of veterans whom I’m working hard to represent. We honored some standout VA employees. And we took questions from the press on VA funding for the replacement or renewal of aging hospitals like Roedebush. Big dollars. Big challenge. And yet it’s crucial that we care for our veterans.

I had the opportunity to meet and thank some of the law enforcement professionals that work within the Veterans Affairs police force. 4,000 law enforcement officers work for the VA force at 170 VA hospitals and many more VA clinics across our country. https://t.co/Hr0ZM1II4Q

Indiana’s leading heavy equipment supplier— and one of the largest Caterpillar dealerships in America — is headquartered in our 6th district. 
I appreciate the behind-the-scenes tour from the MacAllister family. The equipment they sell and service powers infrastructure construction. And that’s something I’m working hard to advance on the @TransportGOP.

Since 1907, hard-working Hoosiers have been doing heavy maintenance on locomotives and rail cars in Beech Grove.  Since ‘75, it’s been Amtrak’s primary US maintenance center — and a steady employer in my district. Their work intersects with my work on @TransportGOP. I learned a lot there that’ll inform my work on the Railroads and Pipelines subcommittee.

Indy’s Perry Twp and Johnson County are home to the largest Burmese Chin population in the US. I represent 30,000 members of this growing community. My meeting this week with Southside Chin leaders covered a lot of ground on issues that intersect with my work on the South and Central Asia subcommittee on @HouseForeignGOP.

Received a scam text, call or email lately? I personally get scam toll road fee texts way too often.

Hoosiers have been targeted by online scammers. I’ve introduced a bill to combat foreign scam organizations that are targeting Americans. We need law enforcement tools and a clear pathway to better protect citizens from falling victim to common and costly fraudulent, foreign scammers. 
https://t.co/AHkx2QUHNT

In the busyness, the fun — and even the disapointment of victories and losses at the #IMS and at #gainbridgefieldhouse  — let’s keep our heads and hearts centered on the anchor of this holiday weekend:  the many brave men and women who came before us — and SERVED our nation. https://t.co/adkdOYXptc

It's a big weekend for Indy! I'm eager to cheer on the @Pacers during tonight’s big game! Their playoff run has brought energy to fans across the state. Wishing them the best of luck on another hard-fought win! https://t.co/fDzmVC9Gtc
Mary & I are ready for the Race! https://t.co/eWh0bTvz5y

Two young Israeli embassy staffers were killed in violence last night. And in the heart of Washington. My wife Mary and I were crossing Independence Ave as the US Capitol Police were responding in force. We knew something terrible had happened…

This was yet another attack against the Jewish community. This one hit close to home. We’re in solidarity with the families aggrieved by this tragedy. Antisemitism has no place — especially within our American society. https://t.co/R9pClJb4zH

Mary and I — along with so many Hoosiers — are saddened by the passing of Jim Irsay. He was a steadfast supporter of our community. Jim leaves behind a lasting legacy in our state, and the Colts organization. Our prayers are with his family and friends. https://t.co/n7QnkHNoqw
.@HouseGOP secured wins for Hoosiers and the American people today with passage of HR1. https://t.co/jWAvOk2FNy

.@Cummins was on our National Mall in Washington. They showcased their state-of-the-art diesel engines. These power plants are at the heart of our transportation industry — in America and beyond. It was good to have them in Washington for the @TransportGOP Celebration of Construction event!

This year’s class of the Indiana Leadership Forum was on Capitol Hill for their capstone trip this week. It’s one of Indiana’s top-shelf leadership development programs. I enjoyed sharing and learning from the talented cast in this year’s class when they were at our Capitol! https://t.co/v3iLbcGl5Y

I was honored to receive the @USCG seal from Senior Chief Colin Ryan.

We’ll display this proudly in our Capitol Hill office — as a symbol of the respect we hold for the service and the dedication of our Coasties!

In my service on the @TransportGOP, we’re making big investments in strengthening our US Coast Guard. They’re the closest line of defense in our US waters. They’re pivotal to enforcing our border security policy.

Our law enforcement officers faithfully keep Hoosier communities safe. I had the opportunity to recognize our Johnson County Sheriff, Duane Burgess, for his leadership in #CD6. He joined me in DC as we commemorated #NationalPoliceWeek. @HouseGOP remains committed to supporting our men and women in blue.

Indiana is at the Crossroads of America. I met with members of @intrucking to discuss our shared transportation priorities in #CD6. It’s always helpful to learn from our Hoosier leaders in the trucking industry. https://t.co/3SgjFhz8DN

Today, we mark 100 days of promises made and promises kept.

.@HouseGOP and the @WhiteHouse have been delivering — for the American people.

✅Securing our southern border 
✅Unleashing American energy dominance
✅Deporting terrorists and illegal criminals
✅Investing in American manufacturing
✅Saving billions of dollars for the American taxpayers
Over 200 local business leaders gathered in Franklin @AspireJohnsonCo. We honored five Johnson County businesses that are powering our local economy forward! https://t.co/pEybCK2T41

Participated in an @INFarmBureau Shop Talk with #IN06 farmers. The conversation centered on the Farm Bill, on trade and taxes. There’s more listening in this job than talking. And these listen and learn opportunities are central to the work when I’m back in my district. You can’t represent —  if you don’t listen!

My office has heard from countless Hoosiers this year about US Postal Service package delivery delays. I finally got a firsthand look inside Indy's massive USPS distribution hub. I'll hold our USPS accountable for reliable service. https://t.co/BLYD9Nycu7

Congratulations to our team of extraordinary young students at Greenfield-Central High School. Winning the Indiana State Robotics Championship is a well-deserved honor. Their work underscores the importance of a STEM education. These talented Hoosiers are shaping our future! https://t.co/AWbVZ86e1I

Indiana is one of our nation’s top coal producers. Passage of this important legislation is a win for Hoosiers working to provide clean coal to power our electric generation needs. 

Coal is an affordable, reliable source of American energy. And the scrubber technology in today’s power plants has advanced dramatically.

The American people voted for change. House Republicans are delivering.

Today, I voted to pass the budget resolution. We’re now a step closer to delivering substantial savings for the American people, to securing our Southern border, and unleashing American energy production.

Non-citizens should not vote in our elections. Today, I voted to pass the SAVE Act to prevent this from happening. This bill strengthens current law, providing measures to ensure that only U.S. citizens may vote in our Federal elections. 
 
Free and fair elections are a key component of our country’s democratic process. It's our responsibility to ensure they're secure — and for US citizens only. This election integrity bill is common sense.

Biased judges are pursuing their own agenda. I voted today to pass the No Rogue Rulings Act — limiting the power of district court judges in issuing nationwide injunctions.

This bill will work to prevent so-called 'Judge Shopping,' which is used to ensure a politically partisan ruling. @HouseGOP is working to restore trust and balance in our judicial system.

Surveying the cresting flood waters today in Columbus with Mayor Mary Ferdon and Columbus fire chief Andy Lay. Floods have cut off access to downtown from I-65, along State Road 46. Our office is here to assist. Please continue to stay safe out there! https://t.co/LAWYv7TZ0d

.@INDairport served 10 millions passengers last year. Our Indy air traffic controllers keep the airspace in our region safe. We’re at the Crossroads of America — on the ground AND in the skies of above.

I got a closer look at our control tower — and the regional air traffic control center here that serves several states. I serve you on the House Aviation subcommittee. I'm committed to strengthening our air safety infrastructure. Visits like this guide my work for #IN06 on the @TransportGOP committee in Congress.
https://t.co/KUPlgEPcBX

Illegal border crossings dropped again this past month — to their lowest counts in 25 years. The American people elected change. I’m working to secure our border, and bring safety back to our communities.

My first bill aims specifically to secure our southern border.  It calls for using unspent COVID funds to finish building the border wall. Republicans are delivering on our promises.

Our office is now welcoming applications for the 2025 Congressional Art Competition!

This annual competition is open to high school students living in Indiana’s 6th district. The student-winner will have his or her artwork displayed in the U.S. Capitol! Read more here: https://t.co/MQiSc9wzEQ

Our Vietnam Veterans served our country with bravery and strength. Sadly, many returned to a thankless nation. And 58,000 servicemen and women didn’t return alive. In 2017, President Trump designated March 29th National Vietnam War Veterans Day. I was honored to present two dozen local Vietnam vets with Congressional Commendations. Ret. General Stewart Goodwin joined me at Greenwood Healthcare Center to thank them for their service.

I dove into some of the challenges of caring for our growing Indiana population living with kidney disease. I cosponsored the Honor Our Living Donors Act in Congress to expand federal assistance for living organ donors— increasing the availability of life-saving kidneys for those in need.

Happy National Agricultural Day to our #IN06 farmers! Yep – most folks don’t know that March 18th is National Ag Day…but most folks also don’t know where the food on their tables comes from! Much of it comes from the fertile soils of Indiana -- and only with the hard work of our Hoosier farmers.

Medicare Advantage was the topic this morning — as I sat down in our district office for a listen and learn with constituents. It’s a complicated space — both for legislators and healthcare consumers. https://t.co/u6gHSBvG5s

I joined Richmond Mayor Ron Oler for his annual State of the City address today. He highlighted the community’s growth — with $400 million in new investment and jobs coming in 2025. My office looks forward to partnering with Mayor Oler to accomplish great things for eastern Indiana’s “All America City.”

I voted to keep our government open — while not increasing spending of taxpayer dollars. This CR freezes our federal spending levels. It funds our nation’s military, our air traffic controllers, and our border patrol agents. This CR allows us to work with President Trump to thoughtfully address our out-of-control deficit spending.

I joined small business leaders in Johnson County today to discuss the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. I appreciated this community listen and learn opportunity. Every voice matters.

The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act was enacted in 2017. These tax cuts are set to expire this year. We’ll revert to higher federal tax rates – unless Congress takes action now to extend or make the cuts permanent.

I’m fighting to keep the federal tax rates where they are – and not let them jump back-up. We want individuals and local businesses – most of which are small — to have the opportunity to prosper. 

Your federal government has to live within its means.

Enjoyed listening, learning and sharing with farmers/members of @INCornFarmers, @INSoybean and @ISDAgov. Trade, taxes and the Farm Bill are top of mind as they prepare for the spring planting season. I’m grateful for the hard work of our #IN06 farm families. https://t.co/0HdEkRPvjN

I’m was in Shelby County today to tour the Army Aviation Support facility in our district.  From there, I headed down to Bartholomew County to tour Camp Atterbury with Indiana’s new Adjutant General, Larry Muennich. At 34,000 acres — it’s a big base! I’m proud to represent this key Indiana National Guard training facility here in Indiana’s 6th district.

Enjoyed my meeting at the Rolls Royce aerospace manufacturing center on the Southside. Here, I saw the production of the upgraded B-52 bomber engines, made right here in Indiana. I've heard from dozens of constituents who have had critical packages stuck at the Indianapolis distribution hub. Hoosiers across the state have been affected by these delays since December. I led the Indiana delegation in demanding answers from @USPS on their inconsistent service to taxpayers.

I spoke on the House floor today to honor the memory of a fellow Hoosier, Joey Handlon of Greenwood. Joey lost his life to fentanyl in 2022.

We’ve got to address the fentanyl crisis head-on. We can save lives – and in doing so, honor Joey Handlon's legacy. I voted for the HALT Fentanyl Act last week. It passed the House. This bill can help keep fentanyl off our streets and protect families from experiencing similar heartbreak.

State Representative Michelle Davis has been a champion on policy protecting Hoosier girls and women in sports. It’s a great accomplishment to see her at President Trump’s Executive Order signing.

I’m committed to re-establishing American energy independence. I voted for the Protecting American Energy Production Act. 

This bill will enhance our ability to utilize our domestic resources to promote American energy dominance.

Too many Indiana communities have suffered the impact of deadly fentanyl.

I supported the HALT Fentanyl Act. This bill will make harmful fentanyl substances PERMANENTLY illegal. And it offers law enforcement additional tools needed to keep fentanyl off our streets.

COVID funds have been mishandled for years. It’s time to put them toward something the American people want: A secure border. My first bill delivers for every community & family that’s felt the impact of Biden’s open border policies. It’s past time to secure our southern border. https://t.co/YO5WxWqWyT
